description: Malaysia offers a unique blend of modern development and tropical affordability. It boasts a high safety index (62.8) and quality healthcare (Index: 70.7) at very low costs. The cost of living is attractive (Index: 48.6) with exceptionally cheap dining options (Restaurant Index: 22.6 in some regions, though here noted higher). English is widely spoken (High proficiency), facilitating easy communication. The MM2H (Malaysia My Second Home) program is a well-known option for long-term residency, making it a gateway to Southeast Asia.

visas.name: Temporary Visa (for North-American visitors)
visas.description: Visitors from North America may enter Malaysia without a visa and stay for up to three months under the standard temporary visitor arrangement.
requirements: No visa required for North American visitors; stays up to three months after arrival.

visas.name: Multiple Entry Visa
visas.description: A visa option for business-visiting foreign nationals, allowing multiple entries into Malaysia for periods of three to twelve months depending on business activities.
requirements: Issued to foreign nationals who require a visa for business purposes.
Valid for three to twelve months, depending on the nature of your business.

visas.name: Residence Pass-Talent (RP-T)
visas.description: A 10-year renewable pass for highly qualified foreign professionals to live and work in Malaysia under flexible conditions, including job-change eligibility and inclusion of spouses.
requirements: Includes spouses of the pass holder, and allows the spouse to seek employment without needing a separate Employment Pass.

visas.name: Permanent Residency
visas.description: A pathway to indefinite residence in Malaysia available to select foreign nationals satisfying high value, expertise, or family sponsorship criteria; grants full residency rights once approved.
requirements: Available to high-net-worth individuals, experts in specific fields, certain professionals, and the spouse of a Malaysian citizen.
Applicants must score 65 points out of 120 in a points-based system.
Must present a certificate of good conduct from country of origin.
